page.title: 05Wroxall school 60 years ago.
page.content: Mr.W. left his home at 8.a.m and walked 2 and a half miles to school. If he heard the train go by he had time to run down the hill and line up.They showed their hands and shoes to the headmaster,then went into class to register. They did arithmetic until playtime. Mrs.W. played hopscotch and Mr.W. played whip and top. Then they did maths.They had their lunch in the Board room then went for a walk up to the obelisk. In the afternoon the boys did gardening and the girls needlework. Mrs.W. was once asked to wind a ball of wool.When she took it up the teacher said "What do you call this,it's like a cricket ball", threw the wool at her and said "Now do it properly".At 4 o' clock it was time to go home,they got their coats and bags and walked home.
